article_title: Inventing a GMO Apple That Won’t Brown
article_text:
Two sliced apples sit on either side of a clock as a time-lapse video compresses 24 hours into 30 seconds. By the end, the apple on the left has turned brown but the one on the right has stayed fresh and white.

The demonstration highlights the Arctic apple, as shown in a video made by its producer, Okanagan Specialty Fruits Inc. More than a decade in the making, Okanagan’s new Arctic apple has been genetically modified to resist...

twitter.description: The creator of the Arctic apple—a genetically modified breed that doesn’t brown when sliced—is seeking government approval for sale in the U.S. It could be among the country’s first products required to carry a GMO label.
twitter.creator: @TennilleTracy

image.alt: Inventing a GMO apple that won’t brown

twitter.title: Inventing a GMO Apple That Won’t Brown
